onset.Description: Marks the start of an ongoing event of temporal extent.

duration.LongName: The period of time during which an event occurs.
duration.Description: duration refers to the Image duration, which is contingent on response time after stimulus presentation

event_type.Description: Categorical variable of event types within run

Levels.howhand: Question related to explicit physical attributes of hand related actions, e.g. Is this person reaching?
Levels.whyhand: Questions related to inferring the implicit mental states focusing on hand related actions, e.g. Is the person helping someone?
Levels.whyface: Questions related to inferring the implicit mental states, focusing on face related observations, e.g. Is the person proud of themselves
Levels.howface: Question related to explicit physical attributes of face observations
Levels.block_question_presentation: Prior to eight blocks of trials, the question of interest is presented on screen. For example, 'Is the person admiring someone?' or 'Is the person lifting something?'

participant_response.Description: Participant responds Yes or No, based on experimental question and image presented

Levels.yes: Participant presses yes button to indicate the image matches the question
Levels.no: Participant presses no button to indicate the image does NOT match the question

normative_response.Description: Group responses based on identical trial

Levels.yes: Group responded yes, to indicate the image matches the question
Levels.no: Group responded no indicate the image does NOT match the question

response_accuracy.Description: Correct or Incorrect response in regards to question presented on screen; Options are Yes or No, presented on screen, underneath image. Participants are prompted to respond with MR-compatible button box

Levels.correct: Correct response in regards to question
Levels.incorrect: Incorrect response in regards to question

stim_file.LongName: Stimulus filename which is presented on screen
stim_file.Description: Given text file encompasses test that is displayed on screen. Filename is designated as {digit}{belief_or_photo}_{story_or_question}.txt. Digit indicates the number of stimulus that was presented. b or p indicates whether stimulus was false belief or false photo event. Story or question indicates which event was presented on screen.
